snippet.title: Resident Evil: Outbreak official trailer
snippet.description:
The official Resident Evil Outbreak trailer, with original score.

Resident Evil: Outbreak, known as Biohazard: Outbreak (バイオハザード アウトブレイク, Baiohazādo Autobureiku?) in Japan, is a single player game with online playability for the PlayStation 2 initially released in 2004. This game is the first in the Resident Evil series to feature online multiplayer support; however, online support was not available for European and Australian versions of the game. These features were added in the successor title; Resident Evil Outbreak: File 2. Outbreak was produced by Tsuyoshi Tanaka. Resident Evil Outbreak depicts a series of canonical episodic storylines in Raccoon City set during the same general time period as Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3: Nemesis. It was followed by a single sequel, Resident Evil: Outbreak: File #2. The American servers for this game, however, were shut down on January 2nd, 2008. The servers for the Japanese version are still up.
